elements.name: Journey search from Me screen should show consistent results

steps.name: I am not logged into the system
I am on the "Journey Search" screen
I search for journey using the following criteria:
accept the alert message
I should see the "Out Search Results" screen
I go to the "Recents and Favourites" screen
I should see the following labels are shown:
I click on the "Chester" text
I should see the "Out Search Results" screen
the "Single from" label is shown
the "Passengers" field has "1 Adult" text
the "Railcards" field has "1" text

result.error_message:
java.lang.AssertionError: The "Journey Changes" item #1 of the "Search Results" table doesn't contain expected label: "2 changes". Actual value is: "1 change"
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
	at com.thetrainline.common.steps.generic.ListActions.rowElementContainsText(ListActions.java:157)
	at ✽.And the "Journey Changes" element on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table contains the "2 changes" text(booking/WalkUpBooking.feature:23)

steps.name: the "Journey Changes" element on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table contains the "2 changes" text
the "Departure Status" element on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table contains one of the following labels:
the "Arrival Status" element on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table contains one of the following labels:
the "Platform" element value on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table matches the "Plat\. (\d+)" pattern
the "Journey Duration" element on row No.1 of the "Search Results" table is calculated using the following formula:
I swipe screen top till the end
click on the "Earlier Trains" button
I should see the "Out Search Results" screen
the "Search Results" list is not empty
the "Not available" text is shown
I swipe screen bottom till the end
note the current page content as "Original Content"
click on the "Later Trains" button
I should see the "Out Search Results" screen
the "Search Results" list is not empty
the current page content is different from "Original Content"

name: Live progress in buy tickets results
description:
This change will allow a user to see the live progress of journeys shown in buy tickets. UI to be confirmed. To achieve this we will need to have implemented #57 and will need to sent the request for the Trip with a realtime flag. Realtime queries should just be sent on the day
_In due course we will need to replace this, as this is a coupling to IPTIS which we are migrating away from. _
Note
check when to make the Triprequest and Live Progress calls
